Miles brings Todd's unconscious body to his house, and Marcie and Michael discuss their future plans. Viki offers David Vickers a place to stay, and Blair decides to return to Llanview without Todd.
</summary>

<summary>
Blair and John suspect Miles knows more about Todd's disappearance than he's letting on, while Marty is attacked on the side of the road. Jessica confesses her love for Nash to Antonio, who is heartbroken. Viki and Clint struggle to find a liver donor for Jessica. Cristian and Antonio argue over Cristian's role in keeping Jessica and Nash's affair a secret. Miles pays off some men to attack Marty, but she fights them off. Blair offers to be tested as a liver donor for Jessica. Clint and Viki decide to research experimental procedures for Jessica's liver cancer.
</summary>

The episode revolves around a fire at the Crane estate, which injures Sheridan and Antonio. Eve, a doctor, is torn between her duty to her patients and her desire to be with her husband, T.C. Meanwhile, Liz, T.C.'s friend, is determined to steal Eve's husband away from her.

<summary>
Viki confronts Marcie about her book inspiring the serial killer, while John searches for Natalie. Rex blames himself for Natalie's kidnapping. Antonio receives a note from Jessica, but Viki is more concerned about Natalie. Tess tries to pick up a man at a restaurant but ends up stealing his car. Bo receives a visit from Todd, who claims Jessica is in trouble but won't explain why. Rex and Lindsay support each other as they wait for news about Natalie. John asks Marcie to help him find the killer's next target by contacting her old killing club friends. Viki and Antonio discuss Jessica's note and decide to give her space. A man reports his car stolen to the valet, who reveals it was taken by a woman claiming to be his wife.
</summary>

<summary>
Whitney is back in Harmony and wants to pursue her singing career, much to her mother Eve's dismay. Eve is hiding a secret about her past with Julian Crane, which Whitney is threatening to expose. Rebecca Crane is plotting to evict the Lopez-Fitzgerald family from their home and take custody of little Ethan permanently. Theresa is trying to protect her son from Rebecca's abuse. Liz is rebuilding the Blue Note and offers Whitney a job as a singer. Whitney accepts the job, defying her mother's wishes. Ethan is forced to deliver an eviction notice to the Lopez-Fitzgerald family. The family is devastated and doesn't know how they will come up with the money to pay off the lien on their house.
</summary>

<summary>
Kelly finds Rex in the women's steam room and they have a conversation about Rex's relationship with Gigi and Kelly's lack of sex life.
Gigi is upset with Rex for telling Adriana that they're not having sex.
Adriana and Layla argue about Layla's decision to go to Milan for work instead of spending the weekend with Cristian.
Cole says goodbye to Starr and Hope before going to prison.
John is upset with Natalie for having an amniocentesis without telling him.
Eddie shows up at Ford and James' apartment and causes tension.
Gigi and Cristian go to dinner at the top of the Eiffel Tower.
Langston and Markko say goodbye as Markko leaves for UCLA.
Eddie refuses to leave Ford and James' apartment, and Inez tries to convince her sons to leave with her.
Cole tells Starr that he loves her and is ready to go to prison.
</summary>

<summary>Karen and Colleen discuss adjusting a patient's medication; Kevin confesses his drug addiction to Karen and asks for help; Ian struggles with his vampire hunger and asks Chris for more blood; Elizabeth seeks Lucy's help to find Alison, who has been kidnapped by Joshua; Alison confronts Joshua about his past and motivations; Rafe searches for Alison and encounters Jamal, who is now a vampire.</summary>

<summary>
Whitney's mother, Eve, has suddenly changed her mind about Whitney moving to L.A. with Chad, causing a rift between Eve and her husband, T.C. Eve reveals that she did it to protect Whitney, but T.C. is still confused. Meanwhile, Kay's water breaks prematurely, and she goes into labor. Julian confesses to starting the fire at Liz's club, but T.C. is suspicious. Luis decides to go to Paris to find Sheridan, despite Hank's warnings. Beth is pleased that everyone believes Sheridan left on her own and plans to continue with their scheme.
</summary>

<summary>
Spike confronts his wife Jessica's family about her bruises, threatening to expose secrets if she testifies against him.
Kay and Miguel find themselves in a mysterious, romantic location, away from Fox.
Sheridan and Luis share a tense moment, with Luis trying to rekindle their relationship.
Fancy and Chris discuss their insecurities about Luis and Sheridan's past relationship.
Gwen, Ethan, Theresa, and Jared investigate strange noises in their hotel, leading them to Rebecca and J.T. on a ledge.
Tabitha scolds Endora for interfering with Kay and Fox's relationship.
Noah and Sam argue with Spike, leading to a physical altercation.</summary>

<summary>
Sharon seeks Victor's help to prove Adam's innocence, but Victor warns her about Adam's dangerous nature. Daisy escapes from the hospital, taking her newborn baby with her. Daniel goes missing while searching for Daisy. Daniel is found unconscious and hypothermic in the woods. Phyllis is worried about Daniel's condition and blames Daisy for his state. Daisy is spotted at an ATM across the Canadian border, indicating she has fled the country. Tucker is planning a wedding, and Sofia is struggling with a report from Blake. Heather is served with legal papers.
</summary>

<summary>
Kay is torn between her love for Fox and her desire to marry Miguel, while Fox is desperate to keep her in his life. Meanwhile, Gwen and Theresa are both trying to outbid each other to secure J.T.'s help in winning Ethan's affection. Luis is searching for his missing wife, Fancy, with the help of Sheridan and Chris. Fox discovers he is dying and decides not to tell Kay, while Miguel encourages Kay to call off her engagement to Fox. Fancy is found trapped in a cave, and Luis attempts to rescue her. Gwen believes she has won J.T.'s help, but Theresa reveals that she has outbid her. Fox confronts Kay and Miguel about their secret.
</summary>

Lily and Tyler get stuck in an elevator, and Lily helps Tyler cope with his claustrophobia by telling him stories. Fenmore is accused of pushing Jamie off a roof, and Jamie's parents struggle to believe it. Chelsea meets with Cane about her fashion designs, and Anita encourages Chelsea to find a new man. Summer feels guilty about her role in the bullying that led to Jamie's accident.

Jack has moved out of the Abbott mansion and is struggling with the loss of his childhood home. Gloria is celebrating her victory over Jack but is feeling lonely and misses her sons. Adam is trying to fit in with his new family but is having difficulty navigating his new role.

Genevieve is hesitant to fly to Las Vegas with Jack due to personal matters, but assures him she will meet him there. Victor is revealed to have orchestrated Chelsea's seduction of Billy in Myanmar. Nikki follows Jack to Vegas to try and stop him from marrying Genevieve for business reasons.
Kevin visits John to plead for his mother's forgiveness, while Michael tries to woo Lauren with a lavish gift. Cassie's fever drops slightly, and she has a dream about the night of the accident.

Genevieve thanks Ethan for helping her, but Jill warns her to stay away from Cane. Billy advises Kyle about women, while Phyllis tells him about her pregnancy. Ricky asks Paul for help finding a therapist, but Paul is suspicious of his motives. Daisy and Daniel decide to get married and elope.

<summary>
Victor is upset that Genevieve sold Beauty of Nature to him without telling him about the S.E.C. investigation. Devon celebrates the success of his new song with friends and family, but Harmony leaves early to avoid Neil. Daisy tells Nick and Phyllis that Lauren pulled a gun on her. Lauren is arrested for assault with a deadly weapon after pointing a gun at Daisy. Michael learns about Lauren's arrest and rushes to the police station.
</summary>

<summary>
Victor learns that Adam's body was found and is informed that the Newman ranch is being searched. Phyllis discovers blood on Nick's jacket and worries about the police finding it. Sharon feels no remorse about Adam's death. Jack is informed that his handkerchief was found near Adam's body. Owen Pomerantz, the district attorney, questions Victor about a broken watch found in the trash. Abby meets Ryder at the Athletic Club and they plan to meet again. Lauren is held captive by Sheila's children, Ryder and Daisy. Lauren tries to reason with Ryder, but he remains loyal to Sheila.
</summary>

<summary>
Jack and Amber discuss their relationship, while Sharon struggles with lingering feelings about Nick and Phyllis' affair. Lily returns to work, but is still grieving her miscarriage. Victor approves Adam's acquisition despite Victoria's objections. Gloria confronts Jeffrey about his relationship with Jill. Phyllis and Nick celebrate their anniversary with a treasure hunt. Kay advises Amber to take a chance on love. Lily and Cane argue about her return to work.
</summary>

<summary>
Victor and Nick clash over Newman Enterprises' attempted takeover of Jabot Cosmetics. Jack Abbott calls an emergency shareholder meeting to counter Victor's move. Drucilla and Malcolm await paternity test results, causing tension between them and Lily. Devon feels out of place in the Abbott family. Mac and J.T. discuss their Valentine's Day date, while J.T. expresses concern about Kevin's behavior. Phyllis and Dru argue over the paternity test, with Dru begging Phyllis to stay out of it. Victor offers to buy Jabot's debt at the same price as Nick, causing the bankers to back out of their deal with Nick. Nick feels humiliated and blames Victor for his failure. Nikki tries to reach Victor but is unsuccessful, and Jack puts forth a proposal to sell 51% of Jabot to Chancellor Industries.
</summary>

<summary>
Kevin and Asa discuss how to deal with Willy Dawes, who is threatening them. Kevin refuses to stoop to Dawes' level, but Asa insists they fight fire with fire. Kelly is approached by David Vickers, who claims to be in love with Dorian and wants Kelly's help in winning her over. Dorian calls Blair to talk about Walker Laurence, but Blair is more interested in what's happening at Crossroads with Todd. Antonio's custody hearing continues, with Antonio's lawyer calling Evangeline Williamson as a witness. Evangeline testifies that she is not worried about Antonio's violent behavior and that she offered him a job as a private investigator. Keri and R.J. Gannon are upset with Evangeline's testimony. The judge grants joint custody to Antonio and Keri. Marcie visits Al in the hospital and sings to him to boost his spirits. Larry tells Max that Al needs a liver transplant to survive. Blair and Todd dance together at Crossroads. R.J. is angry with Evangeline for her testimony, but she insists that they should consider negotiating before the judge makes her ruling. David sings "The Impossible Dream" to Kelly, trying to woo her away from Kevin. Dorian tells David that if he can't get the job done, he can kiss the insurance money goodbye. The judge grants joint custody to Antonio and Keri, much to Carlotta's delight. Joey and Jen kiss, and Marcie sings to Al to boost his spirits. Larry tells Max that Al needs a liver transplant to survive. Blair and Todd dance together at Crossroads. R.J. is angry with Evangeline for her testimony, but she insists that they should consider negotiating before the judge makes her ruling. David sings "The Impossible Dream" to Kelly, trying to woo her away from Kevin. Dorian tells David that if he can't get the job done, he can kiss the insurance money goodbye. The judge grants joint custody to Antonio and Keri, much to Carlotta's delight. Joey and Jen kiss, and Marcie sings to Al to boost his spirits. Larry tells Max that Al needs a liver transplant to survive. Blair and Todd dance together at Crossroads. R.J. is angry with Evangeline for her testimony, but she insists that they should consider negotiating before the judge makes her ruling. David sings "The Impossible Dream" to Kelly, trying to woo her away from Kevin. Dorian tells David that if he can't get the job done, he can kiss the
Ian Ward's extortion charges are dropped, causing tension with Nikki and Victor. Chloe decides to seek help for her mental health, while Kevin supports her.

<summary>
Victor Newman's daughters, Victoria and Abby, are in mediation with their father over control of Newman Enterprises. Victor's lawyer, Michael Baldwin, presents a forensic accounting report that clears Victor of any wrongdoing. Vance Abrams, the Newmans' lawyer, argues that Victor is planning to sell a major subsidiary in Dubai, devaluing the company and his daughters' trusts. Victor denies this, but Judge Phelps orders one-third of Newman Enterprises' assets to be frozen in escrow. Meanwhile, Sharon Newman meets with Spencer Walsh, the new district attorney, to discuss her claim that she saw Skye Lockhart in Hawaii. Spencer is skeptical but agrees to look into it. Ronan Malloy, Chance Chancellor's partner, is revealed to have a secret witness in the case against Owen Pomerantz. Heather Stevens, the former district attorney, offers to help Spencer with the case, but he refuses. Ronan's mother, Nina Webster, finds out about Ronan's liver disease and offers to donate a part of her liver to him. Paul Williams listens to Chance's wire recording with Heather and suspects that Ronan was shooting blanks when he was shot.
</summary>

Kevin has been living with Chloe, who faked her death, and has been trying to get her back from Adam, who is holding her captive. Devon paid off Elena's student loans without telling her, causing tension in their relationship. Adam is suing Nick for full custody of Christian.

<summary>
Nick and Sharon discuss their grief over Cassie's anniversary, while Summer throws a party at Phyllis' penthouse with alcohol, leading to a fight between Fen and Kyle. Michael struggles with Lauren's infidelity, and Carmine's stalking of Lauren escalates. Sharon confides in Dr. Watkins about her feelings of loneliness and her relationship with Adam. Nick and Phyllis argue about Summer's independence and her interest in Kyle. Fen tells his parents about Summer's role in the party and his feelings for her. Lauren and Fen discuss Michael's absence, and Summer tells Courtney about her feelings for Kyle. Phyllis visits Nick to discuss Summer's actions and Nick's overprotectiveness.
</summary>

Kevin decides to move to Oregon with Bella, much to his family's dismay. Nikki practices for her concert while Nick expresses concern about her health. Victor wants to bring the Newman family together through the concert. Chelsea apologizes to Kevin for her behavior at Chloe's funeral.

Victor Newman's company, Newman Enterprises, goes public with a successful IPO. Daisy Carter's parental rights hearing for her daughter Lucy Abbott begins, with Daisy testifying about her past actions and desire to be a mother. Diane Jenkins, Victor's ex-wife, reveals she's pregnant and collapses at Victor's ranch, leading to him rushing her to the hospital. Meanwhile, Adam Newman plots to profit from Victor's IPO and Jack Abbott prepares to short the stock.

<summary>Nick struggles with guilt over Cassie's death and the impact it has had on his family. He blames himself for letting her go out that night and for the subsequent fallout, including the breakdown of his marriage to Sharon. He imagines a different life for his family if he had made different choices. Cassie appears to him and shows him a vision of how their lives could have been if he had kept her home that night. Nick realizes that he needs to move forward and stop dwelling on the past. He decides to move back home with Sharon and Noah to try and repair his marriage and be a better father to Noah. Cassie tells him that she will always be with him and that he needs to figure out what he wants and go for it. Nick promises to try his best to move forward and not give up.</summary>

<summary>
Mariah and Tessa plan to leave Genoa City together, with Mariah keeping the reason a secret. Hilary's wedding day arrives, with Devon and Hilary exchanging heartfelt vows. Hilary passes out briefly, causing concern, but she recovers and the ceremony continues. Neil and Lily have emotional moments before the wedding. Devon and Hilary are pronounced husband and wife.
</summary>

<summary>
Jack offers to take a paternity test to prove he's not the father of Phyllis' baby, but Nick reveals he's the father and wants to stay with Sharon. Colleen confesses to her dad about the threatening notes and calls, but he brushes it off as a waste of time. JT finds the neighbor who discovered the Kaplan murders and learns that Colleen's dad was friends with the family. Kevin pays Alex the $10,000 but finds out Alex made a copy of the tape. Sharon thanks Nick for being her friend and supporting her.
</summary>

<summary>
Victoria is offered jobs by Jack Abbott and Ashley Abbott, causing conflict between the siblings. Billy fires Phyllis from "Restless Style" due to her arrest, but she plans to fight back. Adam and Chelsea elope and get married, much to Victoria's dismay. Victor tries to convince Victoria to return to Newman Enterprises. Gloria suspects Jeff and Anita's marriage is a lie and investigates. Jack secretly meets with Jabot board members to keep his position, angering Ashley. Sharon and Victor's relationship is strained as Victor prioritizes business. Phyllis considers writing a blog to defend herself against Billy's article. Billy discovers that the office is being filmed for the TV show.
</summary>

Billy tries to buy one of Daniel's sketches of Amber, but Daniel is upset about it. Billy and Amber spend the night together while Colleen and Daniel grow closer. Jill's SEC investigation is dropped, and she wants to work with Cane to keep Katherine in check. River's daughter, Eden, is taken in by Michael and Lauren, and River's lawyer arrives.

<summary>
Murphy reads Katherine's letter asking everyone to write their thoughts and feelings, then burn the letters to send the smoke to her. Nikki struggles with emotions and has a brief health scare. Jill and Colin decide to continue the party at their house. Neil, Devon, and Hilary dance together. Victor receives news that Phyllis might wake up from her coma. Jill has a private moment at the park, reflecting on her journey with Colin and Katherine's influence. She decides to give the music box back to Katherine, feeling content with her current happiness.
</summary>

Jack decides to resign from the Abbott-Winters Foundation and asks Phyllis to leave the house. Phyllis tries to apologize and ask for forgiveness, but Jack is unwilling to listen. Billy and Ashley argue about Jack's actions and Billy's role in the affair. Neil tries to help Billy understand the importance of taking responsibility for his actions. Nikki visits Ashley to discuss the situation with Jack and Billy, and Ashley expresses her desire for Jack to move on from Phyllis.

<summary>
Jack and Sharon are at odds over whether to write an exposé on Victor Newman's death. Jack wants to, but Sharon is against it. Meanwhile, Nikki is missing in Mexico, and Nick, Victoria, and Paul are worried about her. Adam has taken over Newman Enterprises and fired Victoria, replacing her with Brad Carlton. Jill is upset about an article in "Restless Style" that paints her in a negative light. Cane and Chloe are married and expecting a baby, but Jill wants to throw them a wedding reception. Heather is moving in with Adam at the Newman ranch. Nick is angry with Jack for hacking into his computer and making disparaging remarks about Victor.
</summary>

Phyllis is helping Daisy with her pregnancy and protecting her grandchild. Billy is concerned about Daisy's potential influence on Phyllis and warns her to be careful. Victoria is experiencing morning sickness and suspects she may be pregnant.
Devon and Hilary reconcile and she returns to GC Buzz as host and executive producer. Billy visits Jack's house on Christmas Eve but is asked to leave by Jack.

<summary>
John Abbott has been hospitalized after suffering a minor stroke, causing concern and worry among his family members.
Gloria, John's wife, is anxious to see him but is only allowed to visit him briefly.
John seems to be in good spirits and is making jokes, which reassures Gloria.
Ashley and Jack, John's children, visit him one at a time and express their love and support.
John tells them to be kind to Gloria, as she is upset about his situation.
Ashley and Jack plan to keep John in the hospital until his sentence is commuted to avoid sending him back to prison.
Lily, Neil and Drucilla's daughter, is struggling with her parents' divorce and feels suffocated at home.
Daniel, Lily's estranged husband, is working at Crimson Lights and runs into Lily, who is upset and feels she has no one to talk to.
</summary>

<summary>
Damon is in critical condition after a shooting, and Phyllis is by his side. Ashley's marriage to Brad is ending due to her feelings for Victor. Kevin challenges Michael to a duel over Lauren. Lily confides in Kevin about her past traumas. Nick asks Jack to help Sharon get a job at Jabot. Ashley and Brad discuss their divorce and its impact on their daughter, Abby. Damon's son, Elias, appears to him in a vision, encouraging him to let go of his anger and live.
</summary>

Adam learns from his grandmother that his father committed suicide after losing his company to Victor Newman in a hostile takeover. Faith is found safe, but she's upset that her parents aren't back together. Billy is upset that Victoria wants their daughter Katie to have the Newman last name.

<summary>
Reed, Mattie, and Charlie attend a party where Reed drinks alcohol. Mattie calls the police when Reed tries to drive home. Reed is arrested, and Victoria is notified. Jill decides to sell Chancellor Industries to Jack Abbott, but Billy and Ashley try to convince her not to. Jack decides to leave his mother's care to focus on Jabot, but Jill changes her mind about selling to him. Lily visits Cane and Sam, and Hilary is also present. Devon and Lily discuss Hilary's presence and her relationship with Cane. Lily and Mattie discuss Reed's arrest and its impact on their friendship.
</summary>

<summary>
Chance receives a medal for bravery, and Chloe feels jealous of Heather's attention towards him.
Michael learns that Heather has obtained an arrest warrant for Daniel and is planning to use the grand jury hearing to indict him.
Daniel is upset and considers fleeing the country, but Phyllis and Amber talk him out of it.
Ryder is set to testify in the grand jury hearing, and Daniel tries to get more information out of him, but Ryder remains evasive.
Kevin is determined to get Ryder to testify truthfully and is confident that Ryder will not betray Daniel.
Mac breaks up with Billy after learning about his affair with Kelly, and Billy is devastated.
Billy tries to convince Mac to give their relationship another chance, but she refuses.
Daniel, Phyllis, and Amber discuss their options and decide to trust Michael's plan for the grand jury hearing.
Heather refuses to give Michael any information about the grand jury testimony, and he threatens to expose her prosecutorial misconduct.
Kay considers inviting Jack to invest in her I.P.O., and Jack agrees to let someone else speak on his behalf.
</summary>
